page.title: 06WORCESTERSHIRE HORTICULTURE
page.content:
Stanks Lodge is situated across a large field at the end of Stanks Lane. It was formerly a gamekeeper's thatched cottage and was renovated and re-roofed with tiles in the 1960s. It is occupied by an elderly couple, who formerly ran pigs in part of their garden.
The garden is intensively cultivated and very productive. In July there were carrots, onions, spinach, runner beans, broadbeans, courgettes, leeks, tomatoes, parsnips and cabbages. There were also fruit trees (plums, apples, pears, and damsons) and soft fruit. The quantity of produce far exceeded the needs of the couple, and the wife took the surplus to the local W.I. Market, where high quality fresh produce is always in demand.
